🍎Friendly Reminder:
Time to sign-up for next week!

Hillsboro R-3 is offering Grab & Go breakfast and lunch for students now through August 25. 🙂

This is available to any child 18 or younger living in the Hillsboro R-3 School District. Students attending summer school are already receiving breakfast and lunch for free.
Once summer school is over, those students may participate in this Grab & Go program. 💙

Every student who signs up, gets a free sack lunch and a breakfast for the next day. We use the information in the form to determine how many meals to make each day. Parents need to sign up each week through the link below.

Distribution will be curbside pickup at the High School (in front of the building) between 11:00 a.m. - noon, Monday through Friday. 🕚

Please note, if you sign-up to receive a lunch on a particular day, please be sure to pick it up. Meals will be provided free of cost.

Please click the link to sign-up! https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdRFYR4D90TUZ9TdGTTHt90y18OYX1nXK0VlN8C5W75faPLFQ/viewform

Class of 2020 Graduation and Prom Updates:

Graduation: A very personal graduation was enjoyed by over 85% of the class of 2020. Survey results collected this and last week indicate that an additional graduation would not be attended by a vast majority of the class, and therefore a second ceremony will not be held.
We are grateful to have experienced graduation in such a safe way, and would offer a personal diploma ceremony for any student who was unable to participate on June 3 or 4.

Please contact High School Principal, Mr. Mark Groner or Primary Principal, Dr. Cathy Freeman to schedule a personal ceremony.

Regarding Prom: Covid has precluded our contracted prom venue from opening for groups as large as ours at this time.
We are happy to announce that safety regulations permitting, all of our 2020 graduates will be invited to attend next year’s prom, which will include a special court and coronation just for the class of 2020.

We also want to stress that at home learning will continue through May 27th.

Have a great weekend! 🙂

Here we are again! Another week, another storm. We are watching the weather closely. This afternoon, we participated in a conference call with the National Weather Service.

The current forecast is calling for a potential band of Ice/Sleet that could be up to a 1" in the northern part of our district developing during the day. The current predicted onset time is 9 am, which is immediately after the busses drop off at the Primary.

As I have said before, calling school based on a forecast is always difficult. Especially in light of the past storms that we have had the last couple weeks.

This evening, we will continue to watch the weather. Our hope is that the forecast changes or the storm timelines change.

Good afternoon,

Here we are again! Another week, another storm. We are watching the weather closely. This afternoon, we participated in a conference call with the National Weather Service.

The current forecast is calling for a potential band of Ice/Sleet that could be up to a 1" in the northern part of our district developing during the day. The current predicted onset time is 9 am, which is immediately after the busses drop off at the Primary.

As I have said before, calling school based on a forecast is always difficult. Especially in light of the past storms that we have had the last couple weeks.

This evening, we will continue to watch the weather. Our hope is that the forecast changes or the storm timelines change.

If the storm continues to track as anticipated a decision MAY be made this evening between 8-9 pm, to allow parents to plan for child care tomorrow.

Our focus will always be student, staff, and parent safety. We will keep you updated.

Dr. Jon Isaacson

Due to the forecasted weather of freezing rain and the potential for ice, the Hillsboro R-3 School District will not be session on Friday, January 17, 2020.

Making the decision to cancel school based on a forecast is always uncertain. However, the potential for ice is concerning for our drivers, both bus and car alike.

Due to the forecasted timing of this storm, it could make it extremely difficult and dangerous to get students and staff back home.

It is always tough to cancel school based solely on a forecast and not on actual conditions; but, sometimes that call must be made to avoid the worst case scenarios that could and can result.

As always our main goal is to return your children home to you safe. When there is even the possibility of them being in an unsafe situation, that could be prevented, we must act accordingly.

Dr. Isaacson, Superintendent

Due to the forecasted timing of this storm, it could make it extremely difficult and dangerous to get students and staff back home.

It is always tough to cancel school based solely on a forecast and not on actual conditions; but, sometimes that call must be made to avoid the worst case scenarios that could and can result.

As always our main goal is to return your children home to you safe. When there is even the possibility of them being in an unsafe situation, that could be prevented, we must act accordingly.

Dr. Isaacson, Superintendent
